newsitem.title: UK: EU working week impact must not be exaggerated - EU.
newsitem.headline: EU working week impact must not be exaggerated - EU.

text.p: The European Union's commissioner for the internal market, Mario Monti, said on Tuesday the impact of EU regulations on the working week should not be exaggerated.
"This particular case should not be overdramatised. The directive contemplates a number of exceptions and exemptions," he told Reuters.

"The EC is increasingly stressing the need for flexible labour markets. I hope every member state including the UK would see the big disadvantages...of not taking a cooperative and active stance in negotiations (at the Inter-governmental conference)," he said.
He was speaking on the sidelines of the annual conference of the Confederation of British Industry.
On Tuesday the European Court of Justice rejected the main part of Britain's challenge to an EU law on working hours and rest periods.
Before the ruling, Prime minister John Major said that if Britain did not get protection form the legislation, it would block any new agreements at the Intergovernmental Conference next year.
